text:
Hi there, Adeshewa, nice to meet you! I hope I can help you with any questions you have! I'll try and answer you as well as I can based on my experiences, but if we come across some subject I'm not well aware I can search some resources for you to look into.
It's been only 3 months I'm working in the UK, before that I had been living and working in Brazil, where I'm from. I have worked on several stages of animation productions, but especially with storyboards and 2d traditional and cut out animation.
I read you're in school but very interested in getting into animation. Could you tell me about some project/illustrations you've been working on?

Hello Mr Perin! 

Thank you so much for agreeing to help me! I will make sure that this opportunity does not go to waste and will make sure to ask you any questions that come in mind :) 

I am from the UK, 16 and I am interested in 2D animation and storyboarding industry - maybe concept art but since it's such a competitive job, I am very unsure in pursuing that path. 

In the UK, we have a qualification in secondary school called EPQ (Extended Project Qualification) and it is where you make a project on anything you like in the space of 6 months. For my project I have chosen to create my own manga as I thought it would be fun and it would allow me to make concept art, character references, illustrations and hopefully in future: an animation! Right now, I am gaining inspiration and collecting techniques from other famous manga and manga guides. I personally believe that my anatomy is not the best and so I am striving to improve my anatomy and perspectives so I can include it in my future animations :blush: 

Thank you very much again for this opportunity!
